New Scholarship Honors the Memory of Allyson Grabowski
A new scholarship fund established by anonymous donors rewards students who exhibit the leadership skills, kindness, and Christian character of Allyson Grabowski '20.
Curiosity Takes Alumnus Bramlet From Cardiology Into Virtual Reality
How did Matthew Bramlet '96 go from physician to virtual reality guru, business owner, and researcher? One word: curiosity.
Winter RECORD Spotlights Hard Working Students Fueled By Donor Generosity

Hard work and hustle took on countless forms at GU in 2019. The RECORD, just released, captures month-by-month examples and heaps applause on the many scholarship donors who helped students push through difficulties to come out on top.
Alumnus Donald Easton-Brooks Awarded For Multicultural Contributions
The National Association for Multicultural Education has named GU alumnus Donald Easton-Brooks ’88 recipient of its 2019 Phillip C. Chinn Multicultural Book Award.

Take the first step towards your calling! Greenville University offers a variety of degrees designed to help students thrive in the world and obtain a unique learning experience along the way.
Looking for something more? Our graduate programs provide a means for you to obtain a master's degree and climb in the workplace towards reaching your goals.
English as a Second Language, MA
The time to get your degree has never been better. Our degree completion programs offer multiple programs with a flexible online environment specially suited to the schedules of busy individuals.

Take the next step towards your future, today.

Greenville University master's degrees hold real world value and can be feasibly obtained even through a busy schedule. Due to the online nature of most of our programs, participants are allowed to work when, where, and how it suits them. Learn more about each individual program below.
Earn an MBA (focus on Business Management) from Greenville University in Illinois. Choose a flexible, 100% online MBA program or an accelerated, one-year MBA program on campus in Greenville.
Earn an online master’s degree in Management from Greenville University in Illinois. The 100% online program focuses on the human side of organizations (businesses and non-profits).
Master of Arts in Teaching- Elementary Education
Become a teacher in Illinois by turning your bachelor degree into a Master of Arts in Teaching (Elementary Education). Greenville University offers this unique program in 5 locations in Illinois.
Earn an online Master’s degree in special education from Greenville University in Illinois in just 18 months. The 100% online Special Education Master of Arts program is 30 credit hours.

The admissions office hosts visits throughout the semesters Monday through Friday beginning at 9:00 am. A visit will last 2-6 hours and begins with an information session wherein you will be provided an overview of the College, student life, the application process and financial aid, with time for a question/answer session at the end. Schedule a personal visit or call us at 618.664.7100.

These weekly campus visits and tours are designed to provide you with a time to visit chapel, take a campus tour, attend a class, meet with faculty or staff members, and have lunch. Tours depart from the admissions office at Joy House immediately following chapel, weather permitting.

Preview Days are special one-day events where we welcome many students to campus to visit us. You'll spend a day getting to know Greenville during a fun-packed experience with others who are hoping to attend Greenville University.

Thanks for your interest in applying!
To get started, please select what you want to be from the drop down below, or click on the application below that best describes you.
Jump to an application: I want to be a
You are currently enrolled in high school or have graduated from high school but have not yet attended any college or university. You seek to enroll as a full-time student.
You have been enrolled at a college or university since you graduated high school and you seek to enroll as a full-time or part-time traditional student.

You plan on completing prerequisite coursework and earning an AA or AS degree from a partnering community college. You want to earn your Undergraduate Teacher Education Partnership (UTEP) bachelor's degree and you seek to enroll as a full-time or part-time student.

You are seeking to complete our Bachelor of Science in Business Management, Bachelor of Science in Organizational Leadership, Bachelor of Science in Health Psychology or Bachelor of Science in Criminal Justice Administration programs. You have a number of college credits, some work experience and you are ready to finish your bachelor's degree.
You have earned your undergraduate degree and seek to enroll as a full-time or part-time graduate student.
You are an international student who wishes to study at higher education institutions in the United States, but lack sufficient English proficiency.
You are an international student who does not have full United States citizenship status. You seek to enroll as a fulltime undergraduate student.
You have previously attended Greenville college and withdrew before completing your undergraduate degree. You seek to reenroll as a full time or part time undergraduate student.
You are seeking endorsements in the areas of English as a Second Language, Middle School, Special Education, or Drivers Education coursework.
